item.title: Trump’s $1.5 Trillion Defense Budget Should Not Come as a Surprise
item.description: In the context of global threats to the United States, a long overdue defense modernization bill, and the ambitions of Trump’s signature defense priorities, perhaps the budget request should have been expected.

item.title: When Faith and Geopolitics Collide
item.description: The Dalai Lama is widely revered as an advocate for human rights and nonviolence, but Beijing considers him an existential threat. When the 90-year-old monk passes, a succession crisis will ignite geopolitical flashpoints that world leaders are not yet prepared to manage.

item.title: Imagery from Venezuela Shows a Surgical Strike, Not Shock and Awe
item.description: CSIS experts analyze new satellite imagery of U.S. strikes against Venezuela carried out during the mission to capture Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Why the Golden Fleet Will Sail
item.description: Debates over a new battleship miss the larger issue—how to generate affordable naval firepower at scale. Seen as an arsenal ship, a “Golden Fleet” could reinforce distributed maritime operations while helping reform U.S. shipbuilding.
